form.p: Sign up for the News Update.

a.title: More information about the accessibility of this site.

div.p:
Our school, our state, our country, our world – we are ALL fighting the 2019 novel coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic that has spread around the globe. We are not coming in to school and some of us are not able to go in to work. We are not even able to go visit our friends or go to church. We stay home, practicing “social distancing” to help protect us from getting sick from COVID-19. Many businesses are closed. We see people wearing masks and gloves if they do go out shopping for necessities.
This can be a scary time, and fear of the unknown is a REAL thing - but - knowledge is POWER! By knowing the facts . . .

h3.a: Kirksville Arts Association 2020 High School Art Student Showcase Awards

div.p:
Hello everyone!
I, first of all, hope that everyone is able to stay as safe as possible during this tough time. I surely do miss all of the great interactions I see between staff and students each day and miss all of the other possibilities for creative expressions we could have come up with. Our time will come again, just needing to remember to keep our heads up until then.
Before the need to close local facilities, some of our high school art students were entered into an art competition between 5 surrounding schools at Kirksville Arts Association: Green City, Novinger, Putnam County, LaPlata High School, and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Kirksville Arts Association 2020 High School Art Student Showcase Awards

div.p: With being at home and not being able to go many places I know it can be difficult to find fun creative things to do as a family. Here is a really cool idea to have some fun and create something memorable. The idea is basically painting using a flashlight, I call it flashlight art. You'll need a flashlight, camera, and possible a tripod if you'd like. The camera should be set on a high exposure mode and set on the tripod. Then you turn on the flashlight and move it around in front of the camera. You can make designs just as a flower or smiley face or something simple as zig zag lines. So go out, . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Fun idea from 4th grade

div.p: As the spring season arrives this is normally the time when we are in full swing of track season. However, like everything else with the closing of schools in Missouri MSHSAA has also canceled spring sports for the 2020 school year. This comes at a very bad time for us as we received 4th place last year in the class 1 state track meet. We lost some key pieces to our 4th place finish from last year but also returned many talented athletes to compete again this year. We were looking forward to to being able to compete at the state track meet as a team again this year and also had individuals that had . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Track Season Cancelled

div.p: I hope everyone is staying safe during these uncharted times. This school year has not turned out like we thought it would but GC has stepped up to the challenges. GC teachers have worked hard getting work out to their students. They have been using Google classroom, other online resources, and made paper copies for those students who do not have internet. I am proud of our students as well for being open to differentiating learning styles. They have done a great job of turning in work and using other ways to communicate with their teachers. These are challenging times for . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Stay Safe and Keep Learning

div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 10:55 am CDT

td.span: A chance of rain, mainly before 4pm. Cloudy, with a high near 58. Breezy, with a north wind 17 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 41 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.
Mostly clear, with a low around 45. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 16 to 21 mph decreasing to 9 to 14 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 33 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 67. Northwest wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.
